name.description: The name and identifier of the state. Unique within the root state machine.

type.description: What kind of state (or pseudo state) this state is. E.g. 'regular' for normal states or 'initial', 'final', 'choice' etc for pseudo states. Most UML (pseudo-) states are supported.

label.description: The display label of the state. If it's not present, most renderers will use the states' name in stead.

color.description: Color to use for rendering the state. Accepts all css color names ("blue") and hex notation - with ("#0000FF77") or without ("#0000FF") transparency.

class.description: Class name to give the state in dot and svg output.

active.description: If true the state is considered to be active and rendered as such.

typeExplicitlySet.description: The default parser derives the `type` from the `name` with inband signaling. The user can override that behavior by explicitly setting the `type`. This attribute is there to express that (and make sure that on next parses & processing it doesn't get accidentily re-derived from the name again).

isComposite.description: convenience, derived attribute - set to true if there's a state machine inside the state; false in all other cases. For internal use - @deprecated

actions.description: A series of actions and their types. The type describe when the action takes place (on entry, exit, or otherwise ('activity'))

note.description: Comments related to this state. Some renderers will use the note attribute to render a note (i.e. as a post-it) attached to the state.

statemachine.description: state machine nested within the state.

from.description: The name of the state this transition transitions from

to.description: The name of the state this transition transitions to

label.description: A display label to represent this transition. Parsers can parse this label into events conditions and actions.

cond.description: Condition for the transition to occur.

action.description: Action to execute when the transition occurs.

color.description: Color to use for rendering the transition. Accepts all css color names ("blue") and hex notation - with ("#0000FF77") or without ("#0000FF") transparency.

class.description: Class name to give the state in dot and svg output.

type.description: Whether the transition is external (default) or internal. See https://www.w3.org/TR/scxml/#transition for details.
